newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers slightly up on firm cargo levels.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers slightly up on firm cargo levels.

text.p: Some Singapore bunker suppliers raised their offers slightly on Tuesday following buying demand in the physical market and firmer fuel oil swaps, traders said.
But some said they maintained previous levels as demand did not improve. "You can only raise prices by $1 per tonne if you don't want to scare buyers away," said one supplier.
The 380-cst grade was quoted at $98/$99 while MDO and gas oil were quoted at $172/$175 and $182/$183 per tonne respectively.
